document.masterDocTitle: Study of the genus Meleonoma Meyrick, 1914 (Lepidoptera: Autostichidae) from China, with descriptions of twenty-one new species (II)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Study of the genus Meleonoma Meyrick, 1914 (Lepidoptera: Autostichidae) from China, with descriptions of twenty-one new species (II)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: College of Life Sciences, Nankai University, Tianjin 300071, China
College of Life Sciences, Nankai University, Tianjin 300071, China & zxjyouxiang @ 126. com; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0002 - 4590 - 8480

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of the
segregnatha
-group in China (based on male genitalia)

paragraph.keyLead:
3 Valva with a setose tuberous process at middle on ventral margin ( Fig. 41 ).....................
M. segregnatha
sp. nov.
- Valva without such a process at middle on ventral margin..................................................... 4

4 Ventral margin of valva with several denticles, produced to an apical tooth ( Fig. 30 )...............
M. compacta
sp. nov.

- Ventral margin of valva without denticles, produced to a strong free distal process ( Fig. 32 )...............
M. flavilineata
5 Sacculus with neither denticles nor process apically......................................................... 6
- Sacculus with a process or some denticles apically.......................................................... 7

6 Ventral margin of valva with two cornuted processes apically, saccus same length as uncus ( Fig. 42 ).....................................................................................................
M. taeniophylla
sp. nov.

- Ventral margin of valva without a process apically, saccus 3/5 length of uncus ( Fig. 29 ).............
M. circinans
sp. nov.

7 Sacculus with a process apically, valva parallel-sided from base to apex ( Fig. 39 )..................
M. parallela
sp. nov.
- Sacculus with denticles apically, valva narrowed from base to obtuse apex, or widened medially...................... 8

8 Valva narrowed from base to obtuse apex, saccus pointed at apex ( Fig. 25 )........................
M. acutata
sp. nov.

- Valva widened medially, saccus rounded at apex ( Fig. 37 )...................................
M. microdonta
sp. nov.
9 Transtilla produced to a thumb-shaped process distally...................................................... 10
- Transtilla not produced to such a process distally........................................................... 11

10 Dorsal process of sacculus reaching before middle of ventral margin of valva ( Fig. 28 ).............
M. bidigitata
sp. nov.

- Dorsal process of sacculus reaching before apex of ventral margin of valva ( Fig. 35 )............
M. longihamata
sp. nov.

12 Aedeagus with two cornuti, saccus shorter than uncus ( Fig. 38 ).............................
M. papillisetosa
sp. nov.
- Aedeagus with one cornutus, saccus longer than uncus or as long as uncus...................................... 13

14 Ventral margin of valva with two cornuted apical processes, aedeagus with two spine-shaped processes ( Fig. 27 ).............................................................................................
M. bicornea
sp. nov.

- Ventral margin of valva without an apical process, aedeagus without a process ( Wang 2006a : Fig. 14 ).......
M. trimaculata

15 Ventral margin of valva serrate, sacculus without a process apically ( Fig. 34 )...................
M. ledongensis
sp. nov.

- Ventral margin of valva not serrate, sacculus with two processes apically ( Wang 2006a : Fig. 6 )...........
M. rostriformis
16 Ventral margin of valva with a denticle or a spine at apex.................................................... 17
- Ventral margin of valva with neither a denticle nor a spine at apex............................................. 19

17 Ventral margin of valva with a denticle at apex, sacculus with two processes apically ( Fig. 33 )........
M. forcipata
sp. nov.
- Ventral margin of valva with a spine at apex, sacculus with a spine and a process or with a process apically............. 18

18 Ventral margin of valva dentate in distal 2/3, sacculus with a short spine and a large digitate process at apex ( Fig. 40 ).......................................................................................
M. recticostata
sp. nov.

- Ventral margin of valva not dentate in distal 2/3, sacculus with a process at apex ( Wang 2006a : Fig. 12 )...
M. infundibularis
- Ventral margin of valva with neither process nor tooth....................................................... 21

20 Ventral margin of valva with a large triangular process at base ( Fig. 26 ).......................
M. basiprocessa
sp. nov.

- Ventral margin of valva with a large tooth at middle ( Fig. 36 ).............................
M. mecobursoides
sp. nov.

21 Sacculus with several short spines apically ( Yin &Wang 2016 : Fig. 5 )................................
M. apicispinata

22 Sacculus with one process apically, saccus nearly same length as uncus ( Fig. 31 )...................
M. cuneata
sp. nov.

- Sacculus with two processes apically, saccus distinctly longer than uncus ( Wang 2006b : Fig. 218)................
M. liui
